private_information: Initial stack top->bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F
left_peg.goal: Help move the full tower to the right peg while respecting legal moves.

middle_peg.goal: Help move the full tower to the right peg while respecting legal moves.

right_peg.goal: Help move the full tower to the right peg while respecting legal moves.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem for FastDownwards that moves all disks from the left peg to the right peg following Tower of Hanoi rules.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are six disks labeled A (smallest) through F (largest).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has top->bottom A, B, C, D, E, F; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg empty; middle peg empty; right peg has top->bottom A, B, C, D, E, F.

report.system_prompt: You are the left peg agent. Provide a concise machine-readable factual report describing your local initial stack and any constraints relevant to legal moves. Do not emit PDDL. The orchestrator will use your report to build the global model.
report.prompt: Your name is left_peg. Using your private information and the public environment, produce a short factual report that lists the disks you hold from top to bottom, identifies which disk is currently movable (the top disk), and notes any local constraints. Keep the report compact and machine-readable.

report.system_prompt: You are the middle peg agent. Provide a concise machine-readable factual report describing your local initial stack and any constraints relevant to legal moves. Do not emit PDDL. The orchestrator will use your report to build the global model.
report.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. Using your private information and the public environment, produce a short factual report that lists the disks you hold from top to bottom, identifies which disk is currently movable, and notes any local constraints. Keep the report compact and machine-readable.

report.system_prompt: You are the right peg agent. Provide a concise machine-readable factual report describing your local initial stack and any constraints relevant to legal moves. Do not emit PDDL. The orchestrator will use your report to build the global model.
report.prompt: Your name is right_peg. Using your private information and the public environment, produce a short factual report that lists the disks you hold from top to bottom, identifies which disk is currently movable, and notes any local constraints. Keep the report compact and machine-readable.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in encoding planning problems for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the factual reports from the peg agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that models the Tower of Hanoi instance with pegs left, middle, right and disks A..F. The PDDL must encode the rules: move one top disk at a time and disallow placing a larger disk on a smaller one. Target the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Using the three peg reports as authoritative inputs, generate a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that achieves the global goal: move all disks from left to right in lawful order. Keep action schemas clear and include predicates for disk size ordering, disk-on-peg relationships, and top-of-peg conditions. Enclose the domain and the problem as instructed and ensure the output is suitable for FastDownwards.
